byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations, and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

abstract: Deal struck between Russia and Turkey to allow civilians and insurgent fighters to leave rebel-held neighborhoods of Aleppo, Syria, falls apart after Syrian government and its Iranian forces say they were not informed of deal and resume shelling of rebel-held areas; United Nations calls resumed shelling probable war crime.

headline.print_headline: Amid Rain of Shells, a ‘Final Scream’ From Aleppo’s Civilians
headline.main: Amid Rain of Shells, Aleppo’s Civilians Offer ‘Final Scream’

snippet: Pro-government forces resumed shelling of Aleppo’s eastern neighborhoods, delaying the evacuation of thousands of civilians and fighters....
lead_paragraph: Pro-government forces resumed shelling of Aleppo’s eastern neighborhoods, delaying the evacuation of thousands of civilians and fighters.
